required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of MBL Around Implants Placed in Crestal or Subcrestal Positions: a RCT
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical and Radiographic Evaluation of Marginal Bone Changes Around Platform-switching Implants Placed in Crestal or Subcrestal Positions: a Randomized Controlled Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this randomized controlled trial is to evaluate changes in marginal bone levels and soft tissue dimensions around implants placed with the IAI at different positions in relation to the alveolar crest

detailed_description.textblock: The objective of this randomized controlled trial is to evaluate changes in marginal bone levels and soft tissue dimensions around implants placed with the IAI at different positions in relation to the alveolar crest. Subjects will be included with the absence of 2-4 teeth in the posterior region of the maxilla or mandibular. Twenty patients will be recruited. Two implant placement depths, equicrestal and subcrestal, were randomly assigned to two sites of each patient with a predefined randomization tables (one crestal implant and one subcrestal implant). Patients will be recalled for oral hygiene maintenance and prosthetic controls at 1year, 3 years, 5 years after final restoration.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from baseline up to 5 years after implantation
primary_outcome.description: Baseline will be recorded at the time of implantation. Margin bone loss(MBL) will be recorded at 0 day, 4 months, 1 year and 3 years after implant placement.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 5 years after final restoration
secondary_outcome.description: Cumulative survival rate will be assessed at final restoration, 1 year, 3 years, 5 years after final restoration

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 5 years after final restoration
secondary_outcome.description: Pocket probing depth will be assessed at 1 year, 3 years, 5 years after final restoration

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 5 years after final restoration
secondary_outcome.description: Plaque index will be assessed at 1 year, 3 years, 5 years after final restoration

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 5 years after final restoration
secondary_outcome.description: Bleeding on probing will be assessed at 1 year, 3 years, 5 years after final restoration

arm_group.description: Implants were placed with the implant-abutment interface(IAI) at the level of the the alveolar ridge
Implants were placed with the implant-abutment interface(IAI) 1 mm below the level of the alveolar ridge

intervention.description: Subjects will be included with the absence of 2-4 teeth in the posterior region of the maxilla or mandibular. Twenty patients will be recruited. Two implant placement depths, equicrestal and subcrestal, were randomly assigned to two sites of each patient with a predefined randomization tables (one crestal implant and one subcrestal implant).

Subjects will be included with the absence of 2-4 teeth in the posterior region of the maxilla or mandibular. Twenty patients will be recruited. Two implant placement depths, equicrestal and subcrestal, were randomly assigned to two sites of each patient with a predefined randomization tables (one crestal implant and one subcrestal implant).

facility.name: Guanghua School of Stomatology,Hospital of Stomatology,Sun Yat-Sen University
